pageContext.claim: “They [China] are starting to buy our farm products, big league.”
pageContext.analysis: In fact, China has retaliated against Trump's tariffs by shunning U.S. agricultural products such as soybeans and pork. Virtually all the money collected from the tariffs has been spent on farm subsidies to offset industry losses. When Trump made these remarks, China had agreed to buy roughly $10 million worth of soybeans -- hardly "big league" as Trump claimed.
